review_title: Acer India Pvt. Ltd - A great place to work
pros:
Acer India Pvt. Ltd is a great organization to start your career with. As a brand, especially in the gaming portfolio, Acer has been highly regarded for a couple of years now. Here, one gets to closely work with industry veterans, and learn business responsibilities with great discipline.  
Acer India believes in enriching all its employees with responsibilities that enrich their working experience. It follows a strict open-door policy that helps employees reach out to the senior management for help and advice whenever required. 


One looks forward to joining work every day, and there is a great level of unity and bond that every employee shares with one another. 

The title that they have received over the years of being 'a great place to work' is completely justified given the atmosphere that exists at the workplace.
cons:
Employees have to take more than just their responsibility in order to get their work done. There is a certain level of dependency that at times slows the pace of getting things done faster. 

The shortage of man-power is a certain con at Acer.

pros:
I like this job because our group is working on research and design. I learned tons of stuff that adds value to my career as a software developer and machine learning specialist. We own lots of resources and the boss is definitely supportive. 

My colleagues are talented, friendly, and supportive. We all love sharing what we know to each other. There is no toxic office politics. We all think for the best of the company.  The manager definitely cares its employees. Lots of little treats and benefits here and there, although the salary might not be as pretty as other more on the hype companies.  I am paid well though. Overall its a very fun, relaxed, and self-motivated environment. Recommended.
cons: The directors should have better ideas about the long term plan of the company.

pros: they are strong in Govt / BFSI segment since local players like HCL etc are out of biz
cons:
1. Top management , led by current MD has very low ethical values and are directionless bunch. .
2. They are working for their short term gains, MD , CFO and CSO do the window dressing of the books and they swindle money of the organisation. 
3. All these people are not working for the long term continuation of the organisation.. in last 3 years under current MDs regime company has lost the solid foundation and loyal employee base which was developed by previous MD
4. top two layers of the company say about 15-20 people get 80-90% of the re-numeration benefits/bonus.

pros: Very lenient, laid back, casual atmosphere. People are friendly. Daily quotas for production are low, and averaged over the week. Supervisor for the repair techs is very understanding of family life/work balance and not a slave driver. Quarterly bonuses are almost always at 90% or higher for payouts.
cons: Not much room for advancement or growth within the company at the Temple ASRC location, but is a good starting point or stepping stone for younger people looking for experience, or people close to retirement. Communication from the top down isnt very good, but how many companies have good communication overall. Pay is okay, but not good. It’s just enough to get by.

review_title: Great environment, but can do it better
pros: Great environment, communication flows easy, people is open to talk... if you show y o ir talent and blend into the culture. Salary is fair, work load is huge, but makes you move fast and you start to feel good with the workaholic mood. Product are really great quality, keeps innovating on technology. I'll totally return there.
cons: Some bad people selection has damaged the company, lack of market positioning keeps dragging the brand into the low end price point; sadly they don't yet get how to communicate their product values.

review_title: "Great Place to Work ! An Excellent Organisation !!!"
pros: I have been working at Acer full-time for more than a 1.5 years now and must acknowledge that its a Great Place to Work. You will get your sub-ordinates very co-operative. HR activities are truly fun-filled and amazing in terms of human touch & values for all the employees such as celebrating their birthdays , Annual Day celebrations are grand, fun games, secret Santa, ethnic day etc. etc. I would love to be a part of this Organisation again and again !!!
cons: Nothing much; but yes, the only scope of improvement I see is to integrate the new tools and methodologies as per the current market demands.

review_title: Great place to work and Most trusted and good for learning workplace
pros: When i started the work for acer my lerning is less than 5% about management ,I learned here how to work , how to manage people ,product's . People who trained me very well after having  their busy scedule .The people who is soo far away from us but their support and care always availeble for us. TRUST ,RESPECT AND KNOWLEDGE these are the three privileige i recieve from the acer .
cons: Nothing just try to improving my self and making the better asset for the brand .

review_title: Appearance of a multinational, ran like a family business
pros:
Great product vs cost mix
Aggressive go to market strategy
good place for success in sales and reach targets
Leader corporation in its segment and industry
cons:
Management not very skilled
Bad Marketing and branding strategy
Too much focused on selling low price, even if the company has great costs, they do not make enogh profit on it
Poor organization, with top managers doing 3 jobs at the same time and not focused in any of them
Bad top-bottom communication of strategy

review_title: Changing for the better, but still needs work
pros: Acer is a tough environment to work in, especially if you're remote.  That said, if you can align yourself properly its possible to make change pretty quickly.
cons: Historically Acer was a very top down management style; that's starting to change under the new leadership where management is more open to ideas but it really depends upon the dept you work in.  Also, being remote is tough as lots of decisions are made in real time in Taipei.

job_title: Assistant Marketing Manager in Kuala Lumpur
pros: Established Company, good varieties of products, contents technology update, nice design work from HQ (Taiwan)
cons: Decentralized marketing, only my superior is getting the update from the HQ (sometimes the team is not updated), hence sometimes we do double work. No proper KPI and appraisal system in place.

pros: The only good thing about this company is that is used to earn money because of their computer sales, but that's all in the past. Right now, the company is in very bad shape and probably going to shut down soon.
cons: Absolutely no direction, trying to save the company by creating a new business group is not the way to go. When the company's computer sales decrease and the new business group doesn't earn money either, that's when the company will shut down. Lot's of internal problems and fights that originates from the management level. A lot of corruption with the CTO of the new core business group who stole money from the company and is refusing to leave.

review_title: No Employee Perks = No Incentive To Improve
pros: The worker bees really make the company easier to work at
cons:
- Politics and poor decisions made by HQ in Taipei make it nearly impossible to innovate or really make any changes.
- VERY hard to get promoted
- No annual employee reviews to see how you can improve
- No employee perks except for an annual holiday party you can't even bring a guest to
- Low employee morale

pros: There are some wildly talented people at Acer Computer Australia (ACA) who are really good at what they do.
cons:
There was no on-boarding period when I joined ACA. I was expected to learn about the products and clients by myself, with some random help from a product manager when he had some time to spare.

By the end of the first week, I was solely in charge of a dozen products but barely any idea about client contacts. When I did know, I often took calls about legacy issues. Unsurprisingly, all this back and forth made all of my clients really nervous.

It is probably the most counterproductive workplace I have ever worked in. Needless to say, I didn't stay there for too long.

review_title: happy, but as people come and go, the environment changes.
pros:
- provide a job that fulfill my professional training 
- good welfare
- an environment that can give people pleasure
cons:
- currently they had no specific goal in business, if you are not in the decision level, you cannot change things like this
- the schedule of project is exaggeratedly tight sometimes, people around me are exhausted and not feeling well, but in some other time people got nothing to do.

pros: Nice corporate culture with many fringe benefits. Although it is a bit routine, it is a good place to learn job and balance your work and life. There are many trainings, but a few of them might be related to the job. Coworkers are also nice.
cons: Lacks appreciation. Pay is a bit low with very little growth each year. Too less annual leave; less than 7 days for the first year, and 7 days annually thereafter.

pros:
Flexible working hours allow to manage personal life
Colleagues are very friendly and integrating is easy
Location is beautiful, quite few things to do in town
International environment
cons:
Lately company's processes are too slow compared to the fast market environment
Compensation packages to entry levels are below market statistics (available publicly for Switzerland)
No career path in most of the cases - it's entirely left up to your ability to negotiate internally
Almost no tele-working

job_title: Business Planning Intern in Allston, MA
pros: The staff were absolutely supportive to the interns. Lots of flexibility in terms of work contents. They tried to know your expectations on the intern before and during the internship, providing the best resource they could. You really learned the scope, the culture, and the company after couple months services.
cons: The pay wasn't very competitive. It's more like a learning opportunity than an actual job.

review_title: Fun, but needs to get their act together.
job_title: Senior Business Manager in San Jose, CA
pros: Below average compensation to start, but will gradually increase over time.  Great office location, smart and friendly employees, start up culture do well for everyday work/life balance.
cons: Market share decline is not doing well for the culture.  Leadership has changed and I get the feeling that not everyone is happy with current management. But hey, that's what the company needs, better management.  Can't please them all...

pros: Good environment,  stable, strong top management, decent benefits, acer empowers you to do your job,  management listens, cool products.  good people
cons: flat organization leads to little room for career pathing.   salaries seem to be low in comparison to other similar companies.  No stock options as it is traded on TSE

review_title: One of the Best product company - Acer, with lots of employees benefits, on-site and values. Loved to be back !
pros: Best product company with lots of employees benefits, on-site and values. Your interview to on- boarding and than daily life in Acer is smooths and enjoyable journey Loved to be back !
cons: Nothing as such. Your interview to on- boarding and than daily life in Acer is smooths and enjoyable journey. No cons , Management is excellent and very much approachable.

pros: Great culture to work in.  Good strategy and looking forward to gaming and VR industry.  Global presense to have local support.
cons: Lack of internal education and transferring.  WOuld be better if the education is improved.  Looking forward to new changes.

job_title: Level II Tech Support in Temple, TX
pros: Friendly environment that allows for better individual growth and team growth. Mon through Fri schedule and 8-5 schedule.
cons: No room for advancement. Management does not seem to be on the same page and decisions are not clear and not always properly conveyed or clarified to non management employees.

review_title: One time great employer falling on hard times.
job_title: Anonymous Employee in San Jose, CA
pros: Great sense of ownership from team members.  Decent benefits.  Overall organization lean enough to make necessary chances quickly.  High quality product and inventive product management.  Ability to truly excel in the industry.
cons: Overall lack of vision from leadership in a declining industry leading to staffing cuts in an already lean company.  Most significant teams have been losing talent over the last year.  Overall compensation below industry averages.

review_title: good company but in tough situation
pros: Welfare is better than lots of company,even some global company in Taiwan.Stan lee is really a conscientious boss.
cons: Company is in downturn for years. There is still no good sign so far. It is hard to keep optimistic. the transformation is on going, but did not see any big progress

pros: Good office location.
cons: No formal review process. Low morale.  Unprofessional managers.   No chance to get promoted.   Dead end company on their last legs.

pros:
Decision making is your own
Being proactive is a plus here
Never stop learning environment
cons:
Slow growing, there's some favoritism
Lack of innovation, management is close to receive feedback, this can be solve with a head shacking, now is happening
Constant strategy change, makes complicated to follow up success mid to long term

pros: a company with long history, Global company with an impressive growth in the last years. Excellent products to offer. There are many challenges in any position, so it is almost impossible to get bored.
cons: bureaucracy, non flat organization, Internal communication issues and very long processes. Since it is a global company, procedures and regulations are revised constantly, so probably the things you learn today might not help much in the near future.

pros: Good learning ground, lots of changes around , always a localised culture. Broadly, if you are engaged and hardworking then years will slip by.
cons: HR is practically in-existent worldwide, no career paths\ progression seen anywhere in the orgnisation. Mangement is always in a hurry and never had a long term view.

pros: Nice learning atmosphere , Approachable Senior Management ,
cons: Cost cutting , Value added Performance of individual is not appreciated .
